result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin L. Ross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Benjamin L. Ross is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Benjamin L. Ross was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Benjamin L. Ross was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  Any violation of probation may be considered a violation of this agreement.  Specifically, a failed drug test will be considered a violation of this agreement.
B.  I will pay restitution in the amount of $1433.59 joint & severally with my codefendants.  I agree to pay $477.87 w/in the first year of this agreement to my probation agent.  The balance of restitution will be paid to Probation & Parole over the course of my probation as directed by Probation & Parole.
Pay unpaid court ordered restitution from misdemeanor charges.  Waive restitution surcharge.

timeConds.notes: AMENDED 12-15-2015 to add additional 59 days jail commencing today with no sentence credit.  Work release for employment, mental health appointments, AODA and treatment.

AMENDED 04-05-2016 to add an additional 30 days jail with no sentence credit.
AMENDED 04-11-2016 amended to change conditional jail from 30 days to 6 days to allow Mr. Ross be released from jail on 04-11-2016.

supervisions.notes: AMENDED 02-13-2017 from 260 days jail sentence credit to 291 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Ordered up to 25% of prison funds to be collected by the Department of Correction for restitution purposes.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Pepin Co. District Attorney regarding jail credit.
Partial Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held January 17, 2017

Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recommends 6 yrs in prison system; 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES; 260 days sentence credit.  Atty Rivard argues prison sentence not warranted; suggest 1 yr confinement and order ES.  Court sentences defendant to 9 yrs in WI prison system; 4 yrs IC, 5 yrs ES; eligible for ERP; no eligible for CIP; conditions of ES, pay restitution previously ordered; waive costs; provide DNA sample; 260 days credit.  Advised of felon prohibitions; appeal rights.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 17, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Rivard representing Mr. Ross but confused as it shows Atty Randtke.  Court informs counsel he's considering not accepting the recommendation.  Atty Rivard requests more time.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Letter from DOC re: clarification of costs waived.  Court's response:  costs waived on ability to pay.
Conditional jail sentence amended - Mr. Ross should be released from jail on 04/11/16.
Count 1 - Additional 30 days jail.

Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Continued Probation Review Hearing.  Counsel received letter from DOC, defendant doesn't object.  Court modifies probation to give him an addtional 30 days jail starting today.
Atty S. Joseph Randtke appt'd.
Probation review hearing on April 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing requested by Probation.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Matter rescheduled.  Mr. Ross to contact the State Public Defender with assistance of jail staff.  Probation review hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Probation review hearing on March 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Letter from Dept. of Corrections.
Atty James Krave appt'd. - Next Court Date:  12/15/15.

Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in court with attorney James Krave.  Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PO Agent appears in person.  Counsel rec'd letter from DOC, no disagreement with alleged violation.  Court modifies probation to add an addt'l 59 days starting today with no sentence credit, with work release for employment, mental health appointments, AODA and treatment.
Letter to the court from S/W DOC Probation/Parole Agency.  Review Hearing to be heard 12/15/15 at 11:00 a.m.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recommends 8 mos. jail concurrent on revocation cases & 14CF23 burglary charge recommend 3 yrs. probation.  Atty Bachman requests time served and agrees with 3 yrs. probation on burglary charge.  Court sentences defendant in 14CF15 count 1 & 14CF23 count 2 to 8 mos. jail concurrent with credit for 169 days.   14CF23 count 1 w/hold sentence place on 3 yrs. probation with conditions:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no violations of law; pay unpaid court ordered restitution on 2 misdemeanor charges; waive restitution surcharge; waive costs on burglary case; waive any unpaid court ordered obligations on misdemeanor cases; provide DNA sample; no contact with business premises of Countryside Cooperative.  Advised of felony prohibitions, appeal rights.

Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Oral motion by State to revoke DAGPA on burglary charge.  No objection by defendant.  Court grants motion, accepts defendant's plea and finds him guilty.

Motion hearing at 04-14-2015 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 04-14-2015 10:00 am.
Atty John Bachman appt'd.

Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of letter from probation agent.  Defendant denies stealing prescription meds. & violating electronic monitoring, does not disagree with other dates outlined in letter.  State requests 45 days in the PCJ as requested by P&P.  Atty. Larimore argues addt'l jail.  Court modifies condition of probation & give addt'l 35 days jail.  Release for huber, education, employment, counseling & treatment; no contact with Scott Moulton.
Letter from Atty Schembera advising he was previously his public defender, he no longer represents the defendant.
Probation review hearing on December 1, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Letter from Dept. of Corrections requesting addt'l conditional jail be added for reason stated in letter.
Count 3 Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion.
Refund cash bond.

Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in court with attorney William A Schembera.  Defendant Benjamin L. Ross in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court of plea negotiations in 14CF15, and 14CF23.  Amended Complaint filed in 14CF23. Defendant waives right to P.H. in 14CF23.  DA files Information with the Court. Judge advises defendant of Counts 1, 2 of Information/max. penalties, Count 3 will be dismissed, Count 1 in 14CF15/max. penalties, advised of constitutional rights.  PLQ/WRF filed and reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's WCR & Pleas done K&V, accepts plea in Count 1 of 14CF15, Count 2 in 14CF23 and defers acceptance of plea in Count 1 of 14CF23 and approves DPA.  Court w/holds sentence and places defendant on 2 yrs. probation, concurrent with conditions.  All other counts and cases dismissed.  Appeal rights given.  Any conditions of bond on DAGP are terminated.
